title: Obadiah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Obadiah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 1 chapters.

questions.question: What is the main subject of the vision in Obadiah?
questions.explanation: The vision of Obadiah centers on the judgment pronounced against Edom.

questions.question: According to Obadiah, how has God made Edom among the heathen?
questions.explanation: God declares He has made Edom small among the heathen and greatly despised.

questions.question: What does Obadiah say about the pride of Edom’s heart?
options: It will lead to their exaltation
questions.explanation: The pride of Edom’s heart deceives them, thinking no one can bring them down.

questions.question: Obadiah compares Edom’s exaltation to what bird?
questions.explanation: Edom is said to exalt itself as the eagle, setting its nest among the stars.

questions.question: What is questioned about thieves and robbers in Obadiah 1:5?
questions.explanation: The verse asks if thieves would steal until they had enough or leave some grapes.

questions.question: Which nation’s hidden things are searched out according to Obadiah?
questions.explanation: Obadiah states that the hidden things of Esau (Edom) are searched out.

questions.question: Who does Obadiah say has deceived Edom by bringing them to the border?
options: The men at peace with Edom
questions.correctAnswer: The men at peace with Edom
questions.explanation: The men that were at peace with Edom have deceived them and prevailed against them.

questions.question: What will God destroy in Edom according to Obadiah 1:8?
questions.explanation: God says He will destroy the wise men and understanding from the mount of Esau.

questions.question: Which city’s mighty men will be dismayed according to Obadiah?
questions.explanation: The mighty men of Teman, a city in Edom, will be dismayed.

questions.question: What is the reason given for the shame upon Edom in Obadiah 1:10?
questions.explanation: Edom will be covered with shame for its violence against Jacob (Israel).

questions.question: In the day strangers carried away captive the forces of Israel, how did Edom behave?
options: Stood aloof like one of the strangers
questions.correctAnswer: Stood aloof like one of the strangers
questions.explanation: Edom stood on the other side, acting like one of the captors.

questions.question: What should Edom NOT have done on the day of Israel’s calamity?
questions.explanation: Edom should not have rejoiced, looked on, or taken advantage of Israel’s calamity.

questions.question: What does Obadiah say about the day of the LORD in relation to the heathen?
options: It is far off and distant
It is near upon all the heathen
It will be ignored by the heathen
questions.correctAnswer: It is near upon all the heathen
questions.explanation: The day of the LORD is near upon all the heathen, including Edom.

questions.question: What will happen to the heathen who drank upon God's holy mountain?
options: They shall drink continually and be as though they had not been
questions.correctAnswer: They shall drink continually and be as though they had not been
questions.explanation: The heathen will drink continually and be swallowed down, as if they never existed.

questions.question: What will happen upon mount Zion according to Obadiah?
questions.explanation: Mount Zion will see deliverance and holiness, contrasting Edom’s fate.

questions.question: How does Obadiah describe the house of Jacob and the house of Esau?
options: Jacob is a flame; Esau is stubble
Esau is a flame; Jacob is stubble
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob is a flame; Esau is stubble
questions.explanation: Jacob is like fire and Joseph a flame; Esau is stubble to be consumed.

questions.question: Who will possess the mount of Esau and the fields of Ephraim according to Obadiah?
options: The Philistines and those of the south
questions.correctAnswer: The Philistines and those of the south
questions.explanation: The south shall possess the mount of Esau; the Philistines shall possess fields of Ephraim.

questions.question: What will the captivity of Jerusalem possess according to Obadiah?
questions.explanation: The captivity of Jerusalem in Sepharad shall possess the cities of the south.

questions.question: Who will come up on mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau?
questions.explanation: Saviours will arise to judge the mount of Esau and the kingdom shall be the LORD’s.

questions.question: True or False: Edom is praised in the book of Obadiah for its loyalty to Israel.
questions.explanation: Edom is condemned for its violence and betrayal of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: The prophecy of Obadiah was given concerning Edom.
questions.explanation: The vision concerns judgment on Edom for its actions against Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah states that there will be some remaining of the house of Esau after judgment.
questions.explanation: Obadiah declares there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau.

questions.question: True or False: The men that ate Edom’s bread laid a wound under him.
questions.explanation: Those at peace with Edom betrayed him, metaphorically laying a wound.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah 1:15 says, 'As ye have done, it shall be done unto you.'
questions.explanation: This verse speaks of retributive justice for Edom’s actions.

questions.question: True or False: The house of Joseph is described as a flame in Obadiah.
questions.explanation: The house of Jacob is a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah mentions that Edom’s habitation is high and secure among the rocks.
questions.explanation: Edom dwells in clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah prophesies that the captivity of Israel shall possess Canaanite cities up to Zarephath.
questions.explanation: The captivity of Israel will possess Canaanite territory even to Zarephath.

questions.question: True or False: Edom rejoiced over the children of Judah in their day of destruction.
questions.explanation: Edom is condemned for rejoicing over Judah’s destruction.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah says Edom will be exalted forever.
questions.explanation: Obadiah prophesies Edom will be cut off forever.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The pride of thine heart hath _____ thee, thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock.'
questions.explanation: The pride of Edom’s heart has deceived them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'If thieves came to thee, if robbers by night, (how art thou cut off!) would they not have _____ till they had enough?'
questions.explanation: The verse questions if thieves would leave anything after stealing.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For the day of the LORD is _____ upon all the heathen.'
questions.explanation: The day of the LORD is near upon all the heathen.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And they of the south shall possess the mount of Esau; and they of the plain the _____.'
questions.explanation: The Philistines shall possess the fields of the plain.

questions.question: What is the reason given for Edom’s downfall in Obadiah?
questions.explanation: Edom is condemned for pride, violence, and betrayal.

questions.question: Who are the 'saviours' mentioned in Obadiah 1:21?
questions.explanation: The saviours are those who will judge Edom and establish the Lord’s kingdom.

questions.question: What does Obadiah prophesy about the house of Joseph?
questions.explanation: The house of Joseph is described as a flame in contrast to Esau’s stubble.

questions.question: How does Obadiah describe Edom’s dwelling place?
options: In the clefts of the rock and high habitation
questions.correctAnswer: In the clefts of the rock and high habitation
questions.explanation: Edom dwells in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high.

questions.question: What will happen to the wise men and understanding of Edom?
options: They will lead Edom to victory
questions.explanation: God declares He will destroy the wise men and understanding from Edom.

questions.question: What attitude is condemned in Edom concerning the day of Jacob’s distress?
questions.explanation: Edom is condemned for rejoicing and taking advantage of Jacob’s calamity.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT mentioned as an action Edom took during Israel’s calamity?
questions.explanation: Edom is condemned for not helping but for taking advantage of Israel’s distress.

questions.question: How does Obadiah describe the future possession of the fields of Samaria?
options: They will be given to Edom
questions.explanation: Benjamin is prophesied to possess fields including Samaria.

questions.question: Who is referred to as 'thy brother' in the context of Obadiah’s prophecy against Edom?
questions.explanation: Jacob (Israel) is called Edom’s brother, referencing their kinship.

questions.question: What kind of mountain is referred to as 'my holy mountain' in Obadiah 1:16?
questions.explanation: God’s holy mountain refers to Mount Zion.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah's prophecy indicates that Edom's defeat is certain and irrevocable.
questions.explanation: The prophecy clearly states Edom will be cut off and consumed.

questions.question: True or False: Obadiah speaks about the involvement of foreigners in the capture of Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: The prophecy mentions strangers and foreigners carrying away captives and casting lots on Jerusalem.
